content.text:
Based on this application description, generate a short, concise name suitable for use as a GitHub repository name.
The name should be lowercase with words separated by hyphens (kebab-case) and should not include any special characters.
Application description: "A simple application with a counter that increments each time a user clicks a button. The app should display the current count and have a button that increases the count when clicked. The count should start at 0 and persist across page reloads."
Return ONLY the name, nothing else.
feat: Implement counter with increment and persistence

Based on this application description, generate a concise Git commit message that follows best practices.
The message should be clear, descriptive, and follow conventional commit format.
Application description: "A simple application with a counter that increments each time a user clicks a button. The app should display the current count and have a button that increases the count when clicked. The count should start at 0 and persist across page reloads."
Return ONLY the commit message, nothing else.

<reason>The application displays an error message ("Failed to create counter. Please try again.") and also a "creating counter" status. Both error messages are due to backend issues which is irrelevant. Therefore, the frontend code is correct so far.</reason>
<answer>yes</answer>

Given the attached screenshot, decide where the frontend code is correct and relevant to the original prompt. Keep in mind that the backend is currently not implemented, so you can only validate the frontend code and ignore the backend part.
Original prompt to generate this website: A simple application with a counter that increments each time a user clicks a button. The app should display the current count and have a button that increases the count when clicked. The count should start at 0 and persist across page reloads..

Answer "yes" or "no" wrapped in <answer> tag. Follow the example below.

Example 1:
<reason>the website looks valid</reason>
<answer>yes</answer>

Example 2:

Example 3:

<answer>yes</answer>
